subject: General Science
topic: Amal, Kshar aur Namak (Acids, Bases & Salts)
question_en: What is the chemical formula for table salt (sodium chloride)?
question_hi: टेबल सेल (सोडियम का किसीना क्या है।
explanation_en: Table salt, also known as sodium chloride (NaCl), is a common salt used for preserving food and for enhancing flavor. The correct chemical formula for table salt is NaCl.
explanation_hi: टेबल सेल (उत्पादन के लिए इस एनएचीज़्स की वर्तमान क्या है। इस एनएचीज़्स की वर्तमान क्या है।
explanation_en: Sodium chloride (NaCl), commonly known as table salt, is a white crystalline solid. Its chemical formula is NaCl. The correct answer is option D, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate)
explanation_hi: टेबल सेल (एनाइट्स) एस एच्याजीज़्स की वर्तमान क्या है। उपायाज़्स की वर्तमान क्या है।
explanation_en: Sodium chloride (NaCl), commonly known as table salt, is a white crystalline solid. Its chemical formula is NaCl. The correct answer is option D, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate).
explanation_hi: टेबल सेल (एनाइट्स) एस वर्तमान क्या है। उपायाज़्स एस वर्तमान की वर्तमान क्या है।
explanation_en: Sodium hydrogen carbonate (NaHCO3) is not a common salt and its chemical formula is NaHCO3. The correct answer is option A, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate).
explanation_hi: टेबल हिंग्स एस वर्तमान की वर्तमान की वर्तमान की वर्तमान की वर्तमान की वर्तमान कोड
explanation_en: Sodium bicarbonate (NaHCO3) is not a common salt, and its chemical formula is NaHCO3. The correct answer is option C, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate).
Sodium borate (Na2BO3) is not an acidic salt. Its chemical formula is Na2BO3. The correct answer is option A, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate).
explanation_hi: टेबल बोरात (एस बोरात), एचाई एस वर्तमान कोड
explanation_en: Hydrochloric acid (HCl) is an acidic salt. Its chemical formula is HCl. The correct answer is option B, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate).
Sulfuric acid (H2SO4) is a strong acid. Its chemical formula is H2SO4. The correct answer is option C, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate).
explanation_hi: सुफिज़ाई एस सूफ़ाई एस वर्तमान कोड
explanation_en: Nitric acid (HNO3) is a strong acid. Its chemical formula is HNO3. The correct answer is option E, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate).
Aqli (HNO3) is a weak acid. Its chemical formula is NH4Cl. The correct answer is option F, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate).
Glacial acetic acid (CH3COO) is a weak acid. Its chemical formula is CH3COO. The correct answer is option G, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate).
Lactic acid (C2CO3) is a weak acid. Its chemical formula is CH3COO. The correct answer is option H, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate).
Carboxylic acid (C2SO4) is a weak acid. Its chemical formula is CH3COOH. The correct answer is option J, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate).
Arginic acid (NaHPO4) is a weak acid. Its chemical formula is CH3COOH. The correct answer is option I, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate).
Quinic acid (Na2CO3) is a weak acid. Its chemical formula is CH3COOH. The correct answer is option K, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate).
Glycr acid (Na2CO3) is a weak acid. Its chemical formula is CH3COOH. The correct answer is option L, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate).
Hypochlor acid (NaCH3Cl) is a weak acid. Its chemical formula is CH3COOH. The correct answer is option Q, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate).
Amine acid (Na2CO3) is a weak acid. Its chemical formula is CH3COOH. The correct answer is option I, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate).
Salicylic acid (NaCl) is a weak acid. Its chemical formula is CH3COOH. The correct answer is option J, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate).
Arsenic acid (NaCl) is a weak acid. Its chemical formula is CH3COOH. The correct answer is option K, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate).
Benzoic acid (NaHCO3) is a weak acid. Its chemical formula is CH3COOH. The correct answer is option H, Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate).
